definitions.definition: A state of unconsciousness from which one may not wake up, usually induced by some form of trauma.
A cloud of dust surrounding the nucleus of a comet.
A defect characterized by diffuse, pear-shaped images that in an ideal image would appear as points.
A tuft or bunch, such as the assemblage of branches forming the head of a tree, a cluster of bracts when empty and terminating the inflorescence of a plant, or a tuft of long hairs on certain seeds.
Metonic cycle
One of several similar diseases, characterised by high recurrent fever, caused by Rickettsia bacteria. Not to be confused with typhoid fever.
One who opposes racism.
Opposed to racism.
(of clothing) Snug, tight, form-fitting.
definitions.example: Her close-fitting clothes showed off her assets.

definitions.definition: Intense pleasure.
A state of emotion so intense that a person is carried beyond rational thought and self-control.
A trance, frenzy, or rapture associated with mystic or prophetic exaltation.
Violent emotion or distraction of mind; excessive grief from anxiety; insanity; madness.
The drug MDMA, a synthetic entactogen of the methylenedioxyphenethylamine family, especially in a tablet form.
A state in which sensibility, voluntary motion, and (largely) mental power are suspended; the body is erect and inflexible; but the pulse and breathing are not affected.
To experience intense pleasure.
To cause intense pleasure in.
A scientist studying the field of sociology; a social scientist.
To deprive; to cut off.
To debar from.
To make shorter; to shorten in duration or extent.
To shorten or contract by using fewer words, yet retaining the sense; to epitomize; to condense.
Cut short; truncate.
To curtail.
definitions.example: He had his rights abridged by the crooked sheriff.

definitions.definition: Cut or shortened, especially of a literary work.
definitions.example: The novel was abridged by the author to make the audio recording a more manageable length.

definitions.definition: A route used by traders for commercial transport of goods.
Local disturbance in blood circulation due to mechanical obstruction of the blood supply (vasoconstriction, thrombosis or embolism).
A device used for injecting or drawing fluids through a membrane.
A device consisting of a hypodermic needle, a chamber for containing liquids, and a piston for applying pressure (to inject) or reducing pressure (to draw); a hypodermic syringe.
To clean, or inject fluid, by means of a syringe.
definitions.example: Have your ears syringed! They're so dirty!

definitions.definition: A homeless woman who carries her possessions with her in bags.
Any of the small bones which make up the backbone.
The act of consummating, or the state of being consummated; the state of being completed; completion.
The first act of sexual intercourse in a relationship, particularly the first such act following marriage.
The achievement of perfection.
Termination; the end (as of the world or of life).
The date at which the mortgagor becomes contractually obligated to the mortgagee in a real estate transaction.
Working for oneself, rather than for an employer.
An engine that obtains thrust by taking in air at the front, using it to burn fuel, then ejecting the hot combustion products at the rear through a propulsive nozzle.
Any engine propelled by expelling a high speed fluid jet (jet propulsion), such as a rocket, turbojet, turbofan, ramjet, etc.
A private in the army.
A person who wanders from place to place; a nomad, a wanderer.
(specifically) A person without settled employment or habitation who supports himself or herself by begging or some dishonest means; a tramp, a vagabond.
definitions.example: Every morning before work, I see that poor vagrant around the neighbourhood begging for food.

definitions.definition: Vagrans egista, a widely distributed Asian butterfly of the family Nymphalidae.
An animal, typically a bird, found outside its species' usual range.
Wandering from place to place, particularly when without any settled employment or habitation.
definitions.example: a vagrant beggar

definitions.definition: Of or pertaining to a vagabond or vagrant, or a person fond of wandering.
Moving without a certain direction; roving, wandering; also, erratic, unsettled.
To question (someone) closely in order to verify facts, or information previously given.
To question a trial witness who has already been questioned by the other side.
To store; to put by.
definitions.example: We must lay up enough stores to get us through the winter.

definitions.definition: To disable or incapacitate; to confine to bed.
definitions.example: He was laid up for six weeks with pneumonia.

definitions.definition: To take out of active service.
definitions.example: The battleship is presently laid up in Portsmouth Harbour.

definitions.definition: To go out of active service.
definitions.example: The cruise ship lays up in November for the winter.

definitions.definition: To make a layup with (a basketball)
definitions.example: He takes the pass, he drives, he lays it up and in.

definitions.definition: Deliberately to leave the ball further than necessary from the hole, so as to secure an easier succeeding shot.
definitions.example: Rather than try to reach the green, he chose to lay up.

definitions.definition: A small vehicle based on the same platform as a family car but with a unibody construction and a built-in open tray area for carrying goods; similar but not identical to a pick-up truck.
The audible effect of a shock wave in the air, especially one caused by an aircraft flying faster than the speed of sound
To produce such an effect.
A child’s toy consisting of a (usually wooden) horse mounted on a rocker or swing
Any inflammation of the pharynx that causes soreness.
The same, as a common symptom for many viral and bacterial infections.
To make moral reflections (on, upon, about or over something); to regard acts and events as involving a moral.
To say (something) expressing a moral reflection or judgment.
To render moral; to correct the morals of; to give the appearance of morality to.
To give a moral quality to; to affect the moral quality of, either for better or worse.
To apply to a moral purpose; to explain in a moral sense; to draw a moral from.
To supply with moral lessons, teachings, or examples; to lend a moral to.
Characterized by success
definitions.example: Trading Babe Ruth was far more prosperous for the Yankees than for the Red Sox.

definitions.definition: Well off; affluent
definitions.example: He was raised in a very prosperous household.

definitions.definition: Favorable
definitions.example: He chose a prosperous lottery number that evening.

definitions.definition: A toxic, green, gaseous chemical element (symbol Cl) with an atomic number of 17.
A single atom of this element.
To move silently, stealthily, or furtively.
To act timidly or cautiously.
To use euphemistic language or circumlocution.
Unanswered; not returned; not reciprocated; not repaid.
A stake driven into the ground.

definitions.definition: A type of punishment by which an offender had to rest his or her entire body weight on the top of a small stake.
A tool in mountaineering that is driven into the snow and used as an anchor or to arrest falls.
One of the soldiers or troops placed on a line forward of a position to warn against an enemy advance; or any unit (for example, an aircraft or ship) performing a similar function.
(sometimes figurative) A sentry.
A protester positioned outside an office, workplace etc. during a strike (usually in plural); also the protest itself.

definitions.definition: The card game piquet.
To protest, organized by a labour union, typically in front of the location of employment.
To enclose or fortify with pickets or pointed stakes.
To tether to, or as if to, a picket.

definitions.definition: To guard, as a camp or road, by an outlying picket.
To torture by forcing to stand with one foot on a pointed stake.
Arrogant, having an exaggerated perception of one's positive qualities.
A year in the Julian or Gregorian calendars with an intercalary day added to February, used to adjust for the extra hours of the solar year; a 366-day year.
(inexact) Any other year featuring intercalation, such as a year in a lunisolar calendar with 13 months instead of 12, used to maintain its alignment with the seasons of the solar year.
A soothing medicated lotion for the eyes
Nonsense; flattery; pretentiousness.
To fool with nonsense or flattery.
(intelligence) To keep information secret by sending false information to many people in one's own organization, and correct information to a select few.
A braided plait of hair.
Either of two braids or "tails" on the side of the head.
A twisted piece of tobacco.
A cable that has a connector at one end, and loose wires on the other.
The flamingo flower.
The tail of a pig.
Twisted stent terminal; Stent-end, usually but not necessarily a different fastened part.
Table soccer (US), table football (UK)
A frizzy mass of hair or fibre.
Quality of an image that is unclear; a blurred image.
The random data used in fuzz testing.
A distorted sound, especially from an electric guitar or other amplified instrument.
A state of befuddlement.
To make fuzzy.
To become fuzzy.
To make drunk.
To test a software component by running it on randomly generated input.
To fly off in minute particles with a fizzing sound, like water from hot metal.
(with "the") The police.
Describes a motor vehicle with the steering wheel on the right-hand side, designed for use in countries such as UK and Japan where cars normally drive on the left.
A group of birds that have suddenly started up from undergrowth, trees etc.
To cause to take flight from concealment.
definitions.example: The hunters flushed the tiger from the canebrake.

definitions.definition: To take suddenly to flight, especially from cover.
definitions.example: A covey of quail flushed from the undergrowth.

definitions.definition: Smooth, even, aligned; not sticking out.
definitions.example: Sand down the excess until it is flush with the surface.

definitions.definition: Wealthy or well off.
definitions.example: He just got a bonus so he's flush today.

definitions.definition: Short for flush left and right; a body of text aligned with both its left and right margins.
Full of vigour; fresh; glowing; bright.
Affluent; abounding; well furnished or suppled; hence, liberal; prodigal.
A sudden flowing; a rush which fills or overflows, as of water for cleansing purposes.
Particularly, such a cleansing of a toilet.
A suffusion of the face with blood, as from fear, shame, modesty, or intensity of feeling of any kind; a blush; a glow.
Any tinge of red colour like that produced on the cheeks by a sudden rush of blood.
definitions.example: the flush on the side of a peach; the flush on the clouds at sunset

definitions.definition: A sudden flood or rush of feeling; a thrill of excitement, animation, etc.

definitions.definition: To cleanse by flooding with generous quantities of a fluid.
definitions.example: Flush the injury with plenty of water.

definitions.definition: Particularly, to cleanse a toilet by introducing a large amount of water.
To become suffused with reddish color due to embarrassment, excitement, overheating, or other systemic disturbance, to blush.
definitions.example: The damsel flushed at the scoundrel's suggestion.

definitions.definition: To cause to blush.
To cause to be full; to flood; to overflow; to overwhelm with water.
definitions.example: to flush the meadows

definitions.definition: To excite, inflame.
(of a toilet) To be cleansed by being flooded with generous quantities of water.
definitions.example: There must be somebody home: I just heard the toilet flushing.

definitions.definition: To clear (a buffer) of its contents.
To flow and spread suddenly; to rush.
definitions.example: Blood flushes into the face.

definitions.definition: To show red; to shine suddenly; to glow.
To fill in (joints); to point the level; to make them flush.
To operate a placer mine, where the continuous supply of water is insufficient, by holding back the water, and releasing it periodically in a flood.
To fill underground spaces, especially in coal mines, with material carried by water, which, after drainage, constitutes a compact mass.
To dispose or be disposed of by flushing down a toilet
A hand consisting of all cards with the same suit.
Typhoid fever
An unbranded range animal.
(by extension) Anything dishonestly obtained.
(by extension) One who is unconventional or does not abide by rules.
(by extension) One who creates or uses controversial or unconventional ideas or practices.
A person in the military who became an officer by going to college while on active duty as an enlisted person.
A queen and a jack as a starting hand in Texas hold 'em.
To take an unbranded range animal.
(by extension) To seize without a legal claim.
Of cattle: unbranded.
Showing independence in thoughts or actions.
definitions.example: He made a maverick decision.  She is such a maverick person.

definitions.definition: A record that was very popular in a former era.
Any boat propelled only by oars; especially one used for recreation or sport
An object made to commemorate a person, mark an event, etc.
A postage stamp issued to commemorate, usually a person or event; also commonly applied to thematic (topical) stamp issues.
Serving to commemorate something.
definitions.example: a commemorative plaque

definitions.definition: To exit from a train; to disembark
definitions.example: If you plan to detrain at the next stop, please begin gathering your belongings.

definitions.definition: To remove a passenger or passengers from a train; to evacuate passengers from a train.
definitions.example: Following the accident passengers were detrained through the rear cab.

definitions.definition: (of an athlete) to reduce one's training, particularly during the offseason, in preparation for a cycle of retraining.
The act of suddenly disturbing anyone; an assault or attack.
A tumultuous assault or quarrel.

definitions.definition: Terror.
To startle from quiet; to alarm.
To frighten; to scare; to frighten away.
Having a great depth of water.

definitions.definition: Carried out at great depth.
definitions.example: deep-water drilling

definitions.definition: Located in or near deep ocean waters.
definitions.example: a deep-water port

definitions.definition: A seabird of the genus Larus or of the family Laridae.
Any of various pierid butterflies of the genus Cepora.
A cheating trick; a fraud.
One easily cheated; a dupe.
(Oxford University slang) A swindler or trickster.
To deceive or cheat.
To mislead.
To trick and defraud.
One who grazes cattle and/or sheep on a rural property.
definitions.example: Graziers on the tablelands are in dire straits because they do not have enough winter feed and will have to keep reducing stock.

definitions.definition: The owner of a large property on which sheep or cattle graze.
To abandon, forsake.
A forlorn hope.
A member of a forlorn hope.
Abandoned, deserted, left behind.
Miserable, as when lonely after being abandoned.
Unlikely to succeed; hopeless.
An army unit having two or more companies, etc. and a headquarters. Traditionally forming part of a regiment.
An army unit having two or more companies, etc. and a headquarters; forming part of a brigade.
Any large body of troops.
(by extension) A great number of things.
To form into battalions.
A railroad system where the trains run on one rail
A train running on a single rail
The making of illegal payment, or bribes, to persons in official positions as a means of influencing their decisions
The activity of giving, offering or accepting bribes
A paste applied to the skin for healing or cosmetic purposes.
A small adhesive bandage to cover a minor wound; a sticking plaster.
A mixture of lime or gypsum, sand, and water, sometimes with the addition of fibres, that hardens to a smooth solid and is used for coating walls and ceilings; render, stucco.
A cast made of plaster of Paris and gauze; plaster cast.
Plaster of Paris.
To cover or coat something with plaster; to render.
definitions.example: to plaster a wall

definitions.definition: To apply a plaster to.
definitions.example: to plaster a wound

definitions.definition: To smear with some viscous or liquid substance.
definitions.example: Her face was plastered with mud.

definitions.definition: To hide or cover up, as if with plaster; to cover thickly.
definitions.example: The radio station plastered the buses and trains with its advertisement.

definitions.definition: To smooth over.
A return (e.g. to popularity, success, etc.) after an extended period of obscurity.
definitions.example: That fad went out with the eighties, but I think it's making a comeback.

definitions.definition: A retort or answer, particularly a quick or clever one.
definitions.example: I wish I had thought of a quick comeback for his comment.

definitions.definition: An occurrence of an athlete or sports team in a competition overcoming a substantial disadvantage in points to win or draw.
A long-term fluctuation in economic activity between growth and recession.
One of a class of teachers of rhetoric, philosophy, and politics in ancient Greece.
A teacher who used plausible but fallacious reasoning.
(by extension) One who is captious, fallacious, or deceptive in argument.
A sophist.
(universities) A student who is advanced beyond the first year of their residence.
One (such as a racehorse) from the same stable.
One from the same organization or background.
A type of prison where prisoners are obliged to do forced labour, usually outdoors.
definitions.example: The labour camps of the old Soviet Union are well described by the writer Alexander Solzhenitsyn.

definitions.definition: The characteristic of being divisive.
A marinade made from various aromatic spices usually with a yoghurt base; often used in Indian cuisine prior to grilling in a tandoor.
A tilak.
(Abrahamic tradition) The one who is ordained by God to lead the people of Israel, believed by Christians and Muslims to be Jesus Christ.
A similar religious figure or awaited divine ruler, such as the Islamic Mahdi.
An extremely powerful figure.
A long walk.
An abrupt increase.
definitions.example: The tenants were not happy with the rent hike.

definitions.definition: The snap of the ball to start a play.
A sharp upward tug to raise something.
To take a long walk for pleasure or exercise.
definitions.example: Don't forget to bring the map when we go hiking tomorrow.

definitions.definition: To unfairly or suddenly raise a price.
To snap the ball to start a play.
To lean out to the windward side of a sailboat in order to counterbalance the effects of the wind on the sails.
To pull up or tug upwards sharply.
definitions.example: She hiked her skirt up.

definitions.definition: Growing further apart; diverging.
Of a series, not converging; not approaching a limit.
Disagreeing from something given; differing.
definitions.example: a divergent statement

definitions.definition: Causing divergence of rays.
definitions.example: a divergent lens

definitions.definition: One that looks or is actively looking; a watcher; an observer.
One having a specific look or appearance.
Someone or something who is remarkably good-looking.
definitions.example: Wow, your new man is much more of a looker than your last one!

definitions.definition: A person who pretends to be interested in purchasing something but has no intention of doing so.
A person who suffers from asthma.
Having the characteristics of asthma, as in an "asthmatic cough".
A whale (Balaenoptera musculus), blue in color and the largest known living animal.
A material in its unprocessed, natural state considered usable for manufacture.
definitions.example: Petroleum is the raw material refined into various fuels and needed for countless chemicals

definitions.definition: Any input to a factory or other installation which processes it.
definitions.example: The assembly plant's raw materials are finished parts from Asian suppliers.

definitions.definition: Make sad or dispirited.
To cast down.
Sad and dispirited.
An order that cannot be currently filled or shipped, but is requested nonetheless for when the item becomes available again.
To treat as a back order.
Oneself alone.
definitions.example: I sat and watched the cars pass all by my lonesome.

definitions.definition: Unhappy due to being alone; lonely.
A map with a visual representation of roads used for automobile travel and navigation. A road map may contain other relevant data, such as terrain or rail roads.
A plan of action, laying out the future actions of participants.
A structured representation of objects to display a development plan. Road maps are used in business for strategic planning and communications.
A form of hockey played on an ice rink with a puck, rather than a ball.
To sign up to have copies of a publication, such as a newspaper or a magazine, delivered for a period of time.
definitions.example: Would you like to subscribe or subscribe a friend to our new magazine, Lexicography Illustrated?

definitions.definition: To pay for the provision of a service, such as Internet access or a cell phone plan.
To believe or agree with a theory or an idea (used with to).
definitions.example: I don’t subscribe to that theory.

definitions.definition: To pay money to be a member of an organization.
To contribute or promise to contribute money to a common fund.
To promise to give, by writing one's name with the amount.
definitions.example: Each man subscribed ten dollars.

definitions.definition: To agree to buy shares in a company.
To sign; to mark with one's signature as a token of consent or attestation.
definitions.example: Officers subscribe their official acts, and secretaries and clerks subscribe copies or records.

definitions.definition: To write (one’s name) at the bottom of a document; to sign (one's name).
To sign away; to yield; to surrender.
To yield; to admit to being inferior or in the wrong.
To declare over one's signature; to publish.
To indicate interest in the communications made by a person or organization.
definitions.example: My YouTube channel has reached 100,000 subscribers.

definitions.definition: A vent or fissure on the surface of a planet (usually in a mountainous form) with a magma chamber attached to the mantle of a planet or moon, periodically erupting forth lava and volcanic gases onto the surface.
A form of firework.
A baked potato.
Land; as opposed to sea.
Silica based glass extruded into fibers that possess a length at least 1000 times greater than their width.

A composite material made from fine fibres of spun glass held together with resin.

definitions.example: to fibreglass the hull of a fishing-boat

definitions.definition: A telephone service in which a caller may converse with an operator on a specific subject.
A similar service which allows conversation among a number of separate callers.
A line or mark made by folding or doubling any pliable substance; hence, a similar mark, however produced.
definitions.example: His pants had a nice sharp crease.

definitions.definition: One of the white lines drawn on the pitch to show different areas of play; especially the popping crease, but also the bowling crease and the return crease.
The circle around the goal, where no offensive players can go.
The goal crease; an area in front of each goal.
A crack.
To make a crease in; to wrinkle.
To undergo creasing; to form wrinkles.

definitions.example: The bullet just creased his shoulder.

To stab with a kris.
A sticky, milky fluid produced in male reproductive organs that contains the reproductive cells.

The severing of the prefrontal cortex from the thalamic region of the brain.
The severing of the sympathetic nerve trunk.
In an acute manner
definitions.example: I minored in physics at university, so am acutely aware of atomic structure.

definitions.definition: A pervasive neurological disorder that is observable in early childhood and persists throughout the lifespan, characterised by atypical communication, language development, eye contact, and sensory experiences.
(now medically obsolete) A diagnosis involving a pathological tendency to engage in self-centered fantasy thinking, historically considered a symptom of insanity and/or schizophrenia.
(4chan) Abnormal and unhealthy focus or persistence, and unhealthy hatred of opposition or criticism.

The range of conditions classified as pervasive developmental disorders, generally held to include autistic disorder, Asperger syndrome, and pervasive developmental disorder - not otherwise specified (PDD-NOS). Also includes childhood disintegrative disorder and Rett syndrome.
To commit burglary.
To take the ball legally from an opposing player.
